p.s: Michel Barnier says in his speech Brexit is clearly a lose-lose situation for both and in the following I will comment on that.

If Britain would stay they could have much greater influence.
A union also better equipped Britain to tackle threats to security, including terrorism and crossborder crime.
And it is also free trade within the EU reduced red tape and enabled companies to grow.
But there are also pros for leaving.
The UK would have improved global trade aggreementsagreements and more selective immigration could have a positive effect on the British job market.
And the EU subjected Britain to slow an inflexible bureaucratic red tipe making it more prohibitive for smaller companies to do business.
So you can see there are pros for leaving and also pros for remaining so the UK loseloses something but they also win something and the EU is winning nothing in my opinion.
